entry: TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}Welcome to the Zeppelin Non-rigid Observer, Flameseeker. This Airship is your safe haven in this distant land of sun and sand. It is outfitted with many Ostvengr technologies and contains multiple facilities for your heroes.{colour_end}

TODO:Most of the buildings have changed, from small cost and outcome adjustments to whole overhauls. Make sure to press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[H]{colour_end} while in a specific building to find out more.

TODO:Each of the buildings now requires a particular relic to be upgraded. To find out where you can find the most of a specific one, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[H]{colour_end} on the quest selection screen.

TODO:{colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end} is a new addition to the resources in BR. It can be used in many situations, including special contraband Trinkets (available in the Oddities Dealer), a luxury stress relief activity, or new provision items.
TODO:To obtain {colour_start|BR_heirloom}Amber Dust{colour_end}, your heroes need to refine it inside the Amber Refinery.
TODO:{colour_start|BR_lost_tek}Lost Tek{colour_end} is another new resource which can be obtained in the Amber Refinery, and is used for expansions at the Side Decks.
TODO:We have now added new panels which show the hero's affiliation and their additional stats. They can be seen in the top left and the middle top part of the hero’s info sheet respectively.
TODO:Heroes' stats have been adjusted, including doubling the DMG, HP and SPD numbers. Additionally, the SPD roll was raised to 12 (previously 8).
TODO:Districts have been replaced by "Side Decks" and are unlocked at week 5.
TODO:Certain Side Decks require other Side Decks to be built before they can be constructed.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}Now, the hero's affiliation is on a per character basis, not per class. Make sure to check it on the hero's panel before using a skill that interacts with it.{colour_end}
TODO:Base Nighttime Ambush Chance is 33%
TODO:Nighttime Ambushes will surprise you.
TODO:If you're camping during Daytime in Exposed Interior, you don't need to spend points on ambush preventions, as those can't happen on these quests.
TODO:Do note that Kvarotz enemies can be part of a Nighttime Ambush.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}The first round of combat is the Preparation Round, during which you can't crit, and most abilities have their ACC halved, while some also have different or additional effects. Make sure to read the descriptions of your skills to see which ones are more effective during it.{colour_end}
TODO:Mark is now subject to Debuff Resist. Make sure to plan according to that in regards to trinkets and other bonuses.
TODO:Abilities that hit multiple targets now have an additional CRIT modifier. They have their CRIT reduced by 40% , 60% and 70% for two, three, and four target attacks respectively.
TODO:Deathblow Resist now starts at 87% , but is reduced each time an enemy’s attack brings the hero to death's door or performs a death's door check.
TODO:The ceilings for the values of Healing Received/Applied and Stress Resist were removed.
TODO:All Damage/HP/SPD values were doubled, and the SPD roll is now 12 (previously 8).
TODO:Stun Recovery Buffs were changed to +40% Stun Res (1 tn), +20% Stun Res (2 tn), +10% Stun Res (1 Battle)

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}Some of the rooms might have Vendors in them- they're indicated by a special icon on the map, and require specific items to be interacted with. Read their description to find out what they're interested in.{colour_end}
TODO:Secret Rooms are now a place of the Perfumer's research- interacting with him grants you a special trinket, which he can upgrade for you at later visits.
TODO:*Please note that you must un-equip Perfumer trinkets and place them in your inventory before giving them to the Perfumer to upgrade for this function to work.

TODO:Light level no longer influences loot gained from combat and curios- instead, different enemies might appear depending on the light level: Lost Legion while the torch is bright, and Kvarotz if the torch is dim enough.
TODO:Resist pop-ups are now removed- if an interaction didn't give any effects, your hero most likely just resisted one.
TODO:In Exposed Interior, using a torch gives a small ACC buff during the day, and lets a hero ignore stealth at night.
TODO:Except for certain enemy factions and encounters, all enemies have a fixed 15% chance of being surprised. This is not affected by torchlight.
TODO:Now, the hero's affiliation is on a per character basis, not per class. Make sure to check it on the hero's panel before using a skill that interacts with it.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}Some of the rooms might have Vendors in them- they're indicated by a special icon on the map, and require specific items to be interacted with. Read their description to find out what they're interested in.{colour_end}
TODO:Secret Rooms are now a place of the Perfumer's research- interacting with him grants you a special trinket, which he can upgrade for you at later visits.
TODO:*Please note that you must un-equip Perfumer trinkets and place them in your inventory before giving them to the Perfumer to upgrade for this function to work.

TODO:Light level no longer influences loot gained from combat and curios- instead, different enemies might appear depending on the light level: Lost Legion while the torch is bright, and Kvarotz if the torch is dim enough.
TODO:Resist pop-ups are now removed- if an interaction didn't give any effects, your hero most likely just resisted one.
TODO:In Exposed Interior, using a torch has different effects based on the time of the day. Hover over the torch to find out what it does in each of the levels.
TODO:Except for certain enemy factions and encounters, all enemies have a fixed 15% chance of being surprised. This is not affected by torchlight.
TODO:Now, the hero's affiliation is on a per character basis, not per class. Make sure to check it on the hero's panel before using a skill and trinkets that interacts with it.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}Here at the Amber Workshop, heroes can refine their hard-earned Amber into {colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end} under the watchful eye of Penitent Leonne.{colour_end}
TODO:At the Amber Refinement, heroes can spend a week to turn a piece of Amber into a small amount of {colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end}.
TODO:{colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end} can be spent at the Tek Exchange to obtain {colour_start|BR_lost_tek}Lost Tek{colour_end}, used for expansions in our Side Decks.
TODO:{colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end} may also be spent at the Amber Den to give heroes an advanced means of relieving stress.
TODO:The Amber Workshop requires Amber to be upgraded, which can be found in highest quantities in the Caverns.
TODO:Both the Amber Workshop and Tek Exchange {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} Heals for a very low amount (10/15/20) and do not remove afflictions.

TODO:The Amber Den requires {colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end} and {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} Heals for a very high amount (100) and has a chance to trigger positive side-effects ( 50% ).
TODO:You can hover over the upgrade icon for the stress relief activity to get more information on each possible outcome.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}The Forge not only keeps the balloon filled with hot air, but also carries the necessary tools for Zofia and her aides to upgrade your heroes' weapons and armor. Keeping your equipment in top shape is vital to your survival.{colour_end}
TODO:The Forge requires Salvaged Jewelry to upgrade, which can be found in highest quantities in the Treasury.
TODO:Equipment now requires the hero to be one level higher than vanilla to be upgraded. This is done to adjust for the higher starting level.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}Our good friend Gaspard is an experienced soldier and keeper to many secrets of the trade. Heroes can spend time perusing his field guides and listening to his tales to learn a new trick or two about camping.{colour_end}
TODO:Gaspard Requires Valor Marks to upgrade, which can be found in highest quantities in the Exposed Interior.
TODO:Remember that all quests now give you one more bundle of firewood compared to vanilla- including short quests- so camp skills have much more value.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}The Training Hall is where Riga and Abbas overview the heroes' training regimens. Unlock and upgrade your heroes' skills here. Heroes with un-upgraded skills may have difficulties with hitting, or inflicting effects upon, higher level enemies.{colour_end}
TODO:The Training Hall requires Valor Marks to upgrade, which can be found in highest quantities in the Exposed Interior.

TODO:Skills now require the hero to be one level higher than vanilla to be upgraded. This is done to adjust for the higher starting level. An exception to that is that heroes are allowed to upgrade their skills to lvl 4 upon reaching lvl 3.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}At Vernon’s Odds and Ends, you can unburden your pockets full of Gold for a choice selection of trinkets. You can also purchase unique Amber Trinkets from his sister Veronica for {colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end}. Both stocks change after every Quest.{colour_end}
TODO:The Oddities Dealer requires Amber to upgrade, which can be found in highest quantities in the Caverns.

TODO:You can click the button in the bottom left corner to see a special set of trinkets, which are purchased with {colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end}. You can get this resource in the Amber Refinery.
TODO:All discounts for trinkets apply only for ones purchased with Gold.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}The Captain's ever-faithful first mate has procured only the best for our supply stores which hold new and powerful items to be used in the field. Additionally, your higher-quality backpacks allow you to carry bonus items and larger quantities per slot.{colour_end}

TODO:Make sure to properly check out all the provisions, as some have changed, and a handful of new ones were added. Some of the additions require {colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end} to purchase, which can be produced in the Amber Refinery.
TODO:All quests now have one more bundle of firewood compared to the base game- even short ones- so be sure to prepare and pack accordingly.
TODO:Your inventory now has 18 slots of space, and the stack size for gold, gems and food was increased.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}Select a Quest to embark on an expedition there. Our Ferry will take you from the Flameseeker to your destination and back. Whether you return with your tails between your legs or with hard-fought spoils, is up to you.{colour_end}
TODO:The Catacombs is the place in which the Levantine army has made their temporary home. This area has the highest quantity of the Matakh resource.

TODO:The Exposed Interior is home to the Wildlanders. This area has the highest quantity of the Valor Mark resource. This region features the Night and Day quests, which can be checked by the quest icons and in the quests' names.
TODO:The Caverns are filled with the Troglodytes. This area has the highest amount of the Amber resource.
TODO:The Treasury is inhabited by the Cactonid. This area has the highest amount of the Salvaged Jewelry resource.
TODO:All Regions have Lost Legion and Kvarotz enemies, which can be found at high and low torchlight respectively.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}Erick oversees the Clinic, an important facility for keeping your heroes’ humors in balance. In the Medical Ward, you can treat diseases with the latest in surgical advancements.{colour_end}
TODO:The Treatment Ward allows you to remove unwanted positive and negative quirks to make place for new ones.
TODO:Positive quirks are locked in by default. To acquire new positive quirks, make sure to free up some slots.
TODO:The Clinic is the most reliable way to cure diseases, as the Disease Kits can only remove newly acquired symptoms.
TODO:Keep in mind that you can treat a positive and a negative quirk at the same time.
TODO:The Clinic requires Salvaged Jewelry to upgrade, which can be found in highest quantities in the Treasury.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}The Ferry is the lifeblood of the Flameseeker, a steady source of Heroes and Provisions. After every Quest, check in to see the latest group of daring adventurers. Don't forget to upgrade the Crew Accommodations here either, which determines how many Heroes can reside at the Flameseeker at once.{colour_end}
TODO:The Ferry requires Matakh to upgrade, which can be found in highest quantities in the Catacombs.
TODO:Heroes now arrive at lvl 1, meaning their resistances are a bit higher, and they don't suffer the stress penalty in lvl 1 dungeons.

TODO:{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}Your primary source of Stress relief. The Galley and its Brewmaster, Almira, are indispensable in ensuring your heroes are not just hale, but hearty as well. Keep in mind that the different activities can bring side effects, both negative or positive, to the Heroes using them.{colour_end}
TODO:The Galley Requires Matakh to upgrade, which can be found in highest quantities in the Catacombs.
TODO:Regardless of the amount of stress healing that an activity provides, Galley will always get rid of the hero's affliction.
TODO:You can hover over the upgrade icon for the stress relief activity to see the exact chances for each possible outcome.
TODO:The Bar {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} Heals for a low amount (40/50/60) and has a low chance to trigger side-effects ( 25% ).
TODO:The Gambling Hall {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} Heals for a medium amount (50/63/75) and has a medium chance to trigger side-effects ( 50% ).
TODO:The Fighting Pit {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} Heals for a high amount (60/75/90) and has a high chance to trigger side-effects ( 75% ).
Le réconfort de l'alcool. {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} -40/50/60
L'ivresse du combat. {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} -60/75/90
L'appât du gain {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} -50/63/75
Traitement des maladies, et autres afflictions physiques.
Transforme l'ambre brut en poussière d'ambre. {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} -10/15/20
Échange la poussière d'ambre contre de la tek antique. {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} -10/15/20
Traitement d'attributs, et autres comportements problématiques.
Les plaisirs de l'ambre. {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} -100

Améliorer l'atelier d'ambre augmente le nombre d'emplacement et la réduction du stress.
Améliorer la forge permet d'acheter de meilleures armes et armures à un coût réduit.
Améliorer Gaspard réduit le coût des compétences de campement.
Le site funéraire ne peut pas être amélioré.
Améliorer la salle d'entraînement réduit le coût des compétences de combat, et augmente leur rang maximal.
Améliorer le marché noir augmente le nombre de breloque disponible et réduit les prix.
Améliorer la clinique accroît le nombre de places disponibles et réduit les prix.
Améliorer le ferry accroît le nombre de héros disponibles chaque semaine ou la taille de la liste de recrues.
Améliorer la taverne accroît le nombre de méthodes de traitement du stress et leur efficacité.
Le ferry est vide. Revenez après votre prochaine quête.

{colour_start|new_champion}Ténébreux (Niv. 6){colour_end}

[ Pont supérieur accessible ]
Aménagements
"Les ingénieurs sont arrivés ! Veillez à ce que leurs cabines soient prêtes dans l'heure, nous avons beaucoup à faire !"
[ Activer les tutoriels est RECOMMANDÉ ] [ Appuyez sur H pour ouvrir les menus d'aide ]
Invité d'honneur
"Tout l'équipage est prié d'accueillir notre invité, et de l'aider à se mettre à son aise !"
+50 {colour_start|BR_heirloom}poussière d'ambre{colour_end}
L'ambre doit couler
L'un de nos mécènes a jugé bon de nous laisser un stock de produits particuliers, dans un endroit bien caché.
+50 {colour_start|BR_heirloom}poussière d'ambre{colour_end}
L'ambre doit couler
L'un de nos mécènes a jugé bon de nous laisser un stock de produits particuliers, dans un endroit bien caché.
+50 {colour_start|BR_lost_tek}tek antique{colour_end}
Quid pro quo
Ceux d'Ostvengr sont aussi généreux que fourbes. Une faveur a été accordée, mais cette faveur devra être remboursée.
TODO:{colour_start|notable}+20% DMG,{colour_end} {colour_start|harmful}+20% Damage Taken on next quest{colour_end} {colour_start|harmful}All Activities in Amber Workshop are Locked{colour_end}
Explosion d'ambre
Un incident dans la raffinerie a provoqué un miasme de fumées ambrées dans tout le navire. Essayez de prendre de courtes respirations.
TODO:{colour_start|harmful}+20%% Damage Taken{colour_end}
{colour_start|notable}Activités gratuites : Taverne Héros inactifs : -10 stress{colour_end}
Minute de silence
Le premier est tombé. Savourons le goût amer de la défaite, avec du vin et une fête.
Maintenance des armes
Une inspection récente a révélé que les lames étaient mal entretenues. Il faut y remédier immédiatement !
Entraînement au tir
Tous les rangers doivent se présenter immédiatement sur le pont supérieur ! Votre adresse au tir doit être évaluée.
Alignement céleste
Les membres de l'équipage doivent se contenter de chuchoter pendant que nos mystiques se livrent à la méditation.

TODO:{colour_start|attacktype}Mystical{colour_end} {colour_start|notable}Skills: +8 ACC on next quest{colour_end} {colour_start|attacktype}Mystical{colour_end} {colour_start|notable}Skills: +5% CRT on next quest{colour_end}
Veillée aux chandelles
Les fidèles sont rassemblés pour une prière solennelle, tout ceux qui cherchent encore une réponse y sont invités.

TODO:{colour_start|notable}+15% {colour_start|healhp}Healing{colour_end} Received if not {colour_start|affiliation_pagan}Pagan{colour_end} on next quest{colour_end} {colour_start|notable}-15% {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} Received if not {colour_start|affiliation_pagan}Pagan{colour_end} on next quest{colour_end}
TODO:{colour_start|notable}-15%% {colour_start|stress}Stress{colour_end} Received if not {colour_start|affiliation_pagan}Pagan{colour_end}{colour_end}
Horrible rituel
Les adeptes des pouvoirs obscurs se sont rassemblés pour rendre hommage à leurs maîtres.
Provisions avariées
Notre dernier ravitaillement était insuffisant. Demi-rations pour tous jusqu'au prochain ravitaillement.
TODO:{colour_start|notable}Provision and Supplies Costs +50ʪ{colour_end}
Ravitaillement improvisé
Nos éclaireurs ont localisé un énorme entrepôt de matériel levantin !
{colour_start|notable}Provisions gratuites{colour_end}
Blessure désagréable
Travaillez trois fois plus dur. Le Capitaine est de mauvaise humeur.
Chances de {colour_start|virtue}vertu{colour_end} -15% (Quête)
Chances de {colour_start|virtue}vertu{colour_end} -15%
Vin contaminé
Plusieurs membres de l'équipage sont tombés malades à cause du vin ! Le bar est fermé jusqu'à nouvel ordre ...
Cochon sauvage
Les tables de jeu sont actuellement fermées. Pour le moment, Almira n'en a pas précisé la raison.
Combat d'exhibition
Un combat que nous attendions tous ! Les autres concurrents sont priés de patienter jusqu'à la fin de l'événement.
Héritage
L'un des derniers à avoir péri avait accumulé une belle fortune, qu'il a légué au navire.
+30.000 {colour_start|notable}d'or{colour_end}
Ertefest
Une vieille tradition Ostvengr ! Amusez-vous bien, mais soyez responsables - ce serait dommage de tomber.
Séminaire sur l'ambre
les collègues de la pénitente Leonne sont en visite pour partager leur expertise dans l'étude de l'ambre !
Cadavre exquis
Erick et Ilya ont découvert un cadavre très particulier, et leurs découvertes aboutissent à des résultats spectaculaires.
Anniversaire du Capitaine
C'est un jour très particulier !
{colour_start|notable}Toutes les activité sont gratuites !{colour_end}
Mercenaires augmentés
Ceux qui ont survécus à l'effondrement d'Ostvengr nous offrent leurs services !
Mercenaires augmentés
Ceux qui ont survécus à l'effondrement d'Ostvengr nous offrent leurs services !
Mercenaires augmentés
Ceux qui ont survécus à l'effondrement d'Ostvengr nous offrent leurs services !
Signaux de fumée
Une poignée de survivants a été repérée en bas, dont certains pourraient nous être utiles.
Concert
Le barde du navire s'est transformé en diable de la musique et ses chansons sont exaltantes !
L'Inconnu
Une silhouette encapuchonnée est mystérieusement apparue sur le navire, prétendant pouvoir défier la mort.
Commerce équitable
Vernon propose d'énormes réductions, prétextant un besoin soudain de tout liquider avant notre retour au port.
{colour_start|notable}-75ʪ sur les breloques{colour_end} (hors Contrebande)
Réunion d'urgence
Un membre de l'équipage a été assassiné. L'un d'entre nous n'est pas celui qu'il prétend être ...
Produits dérivés
Nos amis d'Ostvengr nous ont envoyés un cadeau ! Une boite nommée "Defekt: Nicht Verwenden".
Camp d'entraînement
Riga et Abbas ont trouvé que les performances de l'équipage laissaient à désirer et proposent des cours intensifs.
Soleil noir
C'est plus qu'une simple éclipse. Quelque chose dans les dunes est à l'origine de cet horrible phénomène.
